Credit Risk Quant Credit Risk Quant Singapore As a Barclays Credit Risk Quant, you will be part of a team responsible for understanding the risks inherent in our bank's portfolio of derivatives and financing trades. You will ensure counterparty risk is measured and reported accurately while challenging the Front Office in our role as second line of defense. As part of a wider global team, you will work with counterparts in London and New York to develop best practice risk management approaches and maintain consistency across all regions. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Tracking trends and news in the markets, linking events to our portfolio, guiding the production of reports and presenting findings to senior leaders and risk management Shaping the team's strategy for monitoring and managing the portfolio Helping to form the bank's control environment in line with our objectives while driving the creation of new risk frameworks and limits Leading discussions with the business on their direction of travel and ensuring trajectory is in line with our bank's risk appetite Acting as key contact point within Counterparty Risk for regulatory queries and present our bank's approach to local and international regulators where necessary Considering whether the existing systems will capture risk on trades Explaining the risk drivers on such to colleagues within Risk Identifying the key structural risks in exotic trades, for example structural subordination or liquidity risk What we're looking for: Carrying out all duties in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards Extensive experience in Credit Risk, specifically in the areas of fundamental credit analysis, derivatives, and counterparty credit risk Undergraduate degree in Maths, Physics, Computer Science, or closely related discipline Proficient in stochastic processes and derivatives pricing. Experience in C++, R, Python or similar and fluency in Excel Skills that will help you in the role: Fluent in written and spoken English Masters or PhD in a technical discipline Ability to motivate and lead a team Familiar with financial statements (Balance Sheet etc) and financial instruments (e.g. bonds, equities, convertible bonds, futures and options) Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Associate, Market Risk Reporting Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH804540 Jan 21, 2022 Competitive Job Description Morgan McKinley is working in partnership with a Global Bank who is well known for their top tier Corporate and Investment Banking services. They are one of the well-recognized tier one houses. The Singapore team is looking for an Associate hire to join their Market Risk Reporting team. Reporting to the Risk Officer, you will be part of the global team is responsible for the design and implementation of reporting, dashboarding, over-arching reporting strategy, associated controls & governance and the toolset made available to Market Risk Management. Role and responsibilities Work primarily with Market Risk Managers directly in the gathering of requirements, design and implementation of new content or changes to existing content, as well as ongoing maintenance, validation and adherence to reporting governance Design and production of committee presentations and MI that deliver key messages coherently to regional and global senior management Lead calls and working groups to engage with risk departments to prepare materials for senior management committees Support teams in each region to facilitate regulatory and adhoc data extraction, reporting & analysis requests Contribute to bank-wide global initiatives that impact Market Risk reporting Ensure that reporting is compliant with the requisite Data and Reporting governance frameworks, working with the offshore reporting analysts to execute periodic reporting controls Collaborate with onshore and offshore market risk infrastructure functions in the resolution of risk engine, batch and data quality issues Work with various IT teams across the bank to facilitate system enhancements for Risk, providing business requirements as well as planning and performing appropriate functional and regression testing Represent Market Risk reporting at the various Risk working groups and committees as the delegate of the global head of risk reporting Work with regional risk management teams to elicit feedback / commentary and use in the preparation of senior management and committee decks Transition end user computing to alternate strategic tools to find efficiencies in daily production and reduce the operational risk footprint of the group Key requirements Bachelor's/University degree 2-4 years of relevant experience in a Market Risk reporting role within a financial services institution Strong knowledge of financial products and an understanding of the associated risk drivers Working knowledge of the US regulation that Market Risk is subject to in the region Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to face off to stakeholders of varying levels of seniority Able to work well under pressure either individually or collaborating across diverse groups within the organization An ability to multi-task between BAU activities and project work whilst maintaining a clear view of the firms priorities A process improvement mindset Advanced usage of Microsoft Excel/VBA and proficiency in Tableau or Power BI Ability to manipulate large data sets with SQL as well as knowledge of basic data modelling principles and relational databases If Performance Management Analyst Performance Management Analyst Posting Date: 21-Jan-2022 Location: Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Group Strategy and International Management function supports the Group's corporate and strategic planning and hold the responsibility for providing management oversight to the Bank's overseas banking subsidiaries and branches. We are focused on enabling the sustainable growth of our international business by deepening and entrenching stakeholder relationships across our network. Experience • Minimum 3 year of relevant experience in financial analysis and performance management. • Preferably with experience in analysing large amount of data from various sources. • Ability to create summary reports using MS Excel pivot tables. • Develop excel reports that compile data into understandable formats such as dashboards, tables, graphs. • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a multi-disciplinary team environment. Knowledge and Skills • Proficiency in MS Excel and MS PowerPoint. • Strong interpersonal and collaborative skills. • Highly organized, data driven with strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Operational Risk Officer, Stress Testing Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH800075 Nov 25, 2021 Competitive Job Description Morgan McKinley is working in partnership with a Global Bank who is well known for full services in Singapore, with extensive presence globally. The Singapore team is looking for an Operational Risk Officer to join their 2nd line of defense team, specialising in Stress Testing capabilities. Reporting to the team manager, you will be presented the opportunity to work in the field of Operational risk management, data and analytics that provides exposure to senior stakeholders across non-financial risks. Role and responsibilities Group Operational Risk Management: Support the Head, Operational Risk Stress Testing and Risk Appetite to define the strategic agenda for Stress Testing and Risk Appetite. Risk Appetite: Play a supporting role in enterprise-wide strategy definition and corporate planning, including helping define Risk Appetite for Operational Risk, ensuring the same informs risk identification and control design, where relevant, and proactively providing input and advice as to how to address any breaches Scenario Analysis: Plan the agenda for operational risk scenario analysis book of work by leveraging disparate data sources to identify areas of focus for scenarios. Facilitate Operational Risk scenario analysis workshops working with 1st and 2nd Lines of Defence to quantify low frequency high severity events. Facilitate identification of risks and mitigation actions through these workshops Stress Testing: Support Operational Risk Stress Testing and ensure outcomes are appropriately reflected in capital calibration and planning, Risk Appetite definition and Risk and Control identification and assessment. Facilitate identification of risks and mitigation actions. Able to think through the impact of a stress scenario on non financial risks and able to review and challenge the subject matter experts on such topics. Governance: Support appropriate governance and routines (committees, forums and other) to support the Group Operational Risk Team mandate. Key requirements Minimum 8 years of total experience, preferably in Operational Risk or Internal Audit Market Knowledge: Experience in the banking industry, including demonstrated success in a similar role or 2nd Line function Analytical Skills: Ability to conduct hypothesis testing and articulate outcomes. Advanced stakeholder management skills. Ability to work through information asymmetry and influence people to achieve desired outcomes as part of the role If you are interested in the role and would like to discuss the opportunity further, please click apply now or email Hagen at hlee@morganmckinley.com for more information. Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted. Security Testing Lead - Digital Bank We are New! We are Growing! We are a Startup! We are SC Digital Bank! We are looking for strong talent to be working within our brand new Digital Bank. We are a growing venture with new and exciting problems to solve on a daily basis focused on working towards the mission of creating Singapore's Digital Bank. We are well-backed, agile and do focused work within interdisciplinary teams. If this sounds like a place where you want to work - don't hold back! Send through your profile and get connected in with one of our recruiters to find out more on the opportunity at hand. We're looking for an Offensive & Applied Security Testing Lead (OffSec Lead) to work in our Digital Bank office. We're a small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams. As the Offensive & Applied Security Testing Lead you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, pave new ways of working, and build delightful high-quality products for our customers. Job Description We are building the core cyber security capabilities for our Digital Bank, setting ourselves to build best of bread practices to support a fast paced and innovative lean business. We set the bar high for the security and resilience of our Bank's services, to ensure we are always able to serve our customers and the community. The Offensive & Applied Security Testing Lead will have the unique mission to ensure our systems are robust and secure, and our teams are always at the top of their game in the detection and response to anomalies and unplanned events - but continuously testing them. Our mission: collaboratively improve our ability to detect and remediate vulnerabilities before adversaries exploits them, and our ability to detect and respond to attacks and outages. This is an evolutive role, which involve mature practices such as penetration testing, and more modern and adaptive methods such as Bug Bounties, Red Teaming and Chaos/Resilience engineering. The candidate should have a strong emphasis on working with DevOps and SRE teams on setting the right collaborative culture and ensuring tests are fit-for-purpose, meaningful and source of learning. The Role Responsibility: Our Digital Bank is set for a rapid growth and rapidly evolutive environment, thus the candidate will need to shape and adapt our practices from start-up stage to world-class maturity, continuously maintaining control effectiveness. The role will be set to evolve and grow over time as the company develops. Not exhaustively, the Offensive & Applied Security Testing Leader will own the following outcomes: Design a strong testing methodology to support the innovation, development and operation of our infrastructures and services, automating security testing and intrusion testing as part of CI/CD and periodical activities Manage vendors and engagements with 3rd party vendors providing services such as penetration testing, red teaming exercises and bug bounties, ensuring the quality of their prestation Support the triage of vulnerabilities found to minimize false-positive and assign risk-graded ratings Perform ad-hoc security tests during the development of our applications to ensure security controls are effective and requirements have been properly implemented Work with Application Security, and Engineering to facilitate the end-to-end traceability and auditability of testing, aiming towards continuous assurance Work with SRE and Product teams to validate the resilience and behavioural exploration of the application through (Security) Chaos Engineering and attack simulation Work with the Cyber Defence and DevOps teams to continuously test and improve our detection, response and remediation performance; improve our resilience towards 99,999% to free error budgets for customer-centric innovation Support Threat Intelligence, Risk Quantification and Awareness activities Helps develop shared libraries to be used by developers to facilitate the implementation and testing of their product's security Our Ideal Candidate: Has at least 10 years of relevant technical experience Has demonstrated experience in the security testing of: SaaS-based applications IaaS providers & services (AWS) APIs Cloud-Native platforms (Kubernetes, Service Meshes, Event Streaming) Cloud-based end-user services (O365, Cloud IAM, Device Trust/MDM/MAM) Can develop automation and reporting capabilities, such as SaaS-compliance queries, performance scorecards Has a good knowledge of DevSecOps, Cloud-Native Security and frictionless guardrails Has the hands-on expertise to build and support the operational objectives while the Bank is in its build phase Is experienced in intrusion/penetration testing both as a tester and a vendor manager; and keen to balance technical and management activities Has demonstrated experience running services complying with Singapore's and international standards in offensive security (MAS TRM, ABS AASE, CBEST, ECB TIBER, HKMA C-RAF) and security control testing (OWASP ASVS/MASVS, MITRE ATT&CK). Is ready to introduce novel resilience testing approaches not yet formalised by regulators. Is self-driven, can articulate the risk of missing controls to all levels of executives Understands that not all vulnerabilities are critical, and it is more effective to help users by automating the remediation rather than accumulate a backlog of vulnerabilities Can demonstrate an ability to learn and establish new practices in an environment where priorities compete, and each user's time is critical Has a solid experience in vulnerabilities and advanced attacks relevant for financial services Is collaborative, with a vision of how to work with developers to embed the best practices of security protection while developing better velocity and risk management outcomes Ideally, has experience working in supporting regulated digital payment services such as payment industry & digital banking, or e-commerce services

SeaTown Holdings International (SeaTown), based in Singapore, is an investment manager focused on absolute return/alternative strategies. SeaTown manages both open-end (multi-asset and public credit) and closed-end funds (private credit and private capital/equity). SeaTown is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Temasek Holdings. Job_Title: AVP/VP, Senior Business Analyst, Private Market Solutions
Job_Descriptions: We are one of the largest investment management organizations in the world, with over 1000 people working together to create long-term value. Technology Group The Technology Group (TG) is a key enabler to keep our business moving forward and is constantly exploiting state-of-the-art information technologies to enhance GIC's ability to be the leading global long-term investment firm. We aim to provide users with empowering and transformational capabilities, and to create an inclusive, innovative and integrated work environment. This is an opportunity to join GIC as an AVP/VP, Senior/Lead Business Analyst (Private Market Solutions). You will be the key contact and technology partner with Investment Services Private Markets Department and provide solutions through effective use of technology. This role will be part of an integrated team that provides technology and data solutions for trade processing activities. Exposure opportunities Build and support systems in trade processing critical to investment execution. Support Business Lead or Product Owner to facilitate and elicit requirements from business stakeholders for the purpose of producing Business Requirements Document (BRD) or User Stories. Lead discussions, analyze & conceptualize IT solutions that meet business requirements. Validate IT solutions with engineering and architecture teams, and ensure specifications are properly understood by rest of project delivery team. Present IT solution to business and IT stakeholders to explain how the solution addresses their business requirements. During project execution phase prepare Functional Specifications Document (FSD), along with delivery of Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM). Support project team during the execution phase of the project for any queries pertaining to the FSD or BRD or User Stories. Where necessary, re-engage business SMEs to revise requirements and/or for the acceptance of alternative solutions, due to design or implementation constraints encountered. Support Quality Assurance team to define the test strategy and approach and provide clarifications to queries during the testing phase, to both the Quality Assurance team and Business Testers during testing phases. Prepare training plans and user manuals; and conduct trainings to users before system launch and provide close support to system users in the adoption of the new system. With strong collaborative mind-set, work across facets of the business across Front, Middle, and Back Office, the extended Technology team in GIC as well as industry peers and partners. Work alongside an experienced team of professionals and contribute. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent. At least 2 years' relevant experience in technology business analysis or software development, familiar with business applications in investment/banking industries. Excellent inter-personal and communication skills, with strong ability to manage and align expectations of senior level business stakeholders across different business units to accept solutions proposed by project team. Possesses strong analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving skills and a team player who has growth mindset and confident to work independently. Experience in the documentation of BRD, FSD, use cases, visual modeling and business processes. Experience with ETL process, SQL & API. Experience in Project Management and Agile Methodology skills with strong delivery mindset. Good understanding of financial application, workflow, UI/UX, database design and software engineering best practices.

Job_Title: Head, Risk and Control - Technology Risk Architecture
Job_Descriptions: International l Investment banking with extensive operations in Singapore is looking for an exceptional, experienced, and influential candidate to oversee the governance and implementation of a Technology Risk Architecture. This is a major programme for an experienced C suite level Risk and Control professional A key responsibility is supporting control teams through the delivery of Technology Transformation Risk Management control and design patterns to support in the execution of the Bank's operational and Information risk frameworks. Responsible for providing support, best practice and guidance, as well as 'hands on' support on risk management areas and operating as the interface with senior wider Bank C Suite level stakeholders across all three lines of defence to manage framework and new risk initiatives which need to be adopted. Coach risk managers to upskill on risk and control knowledge. Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development of people and ensure that holders of all critical functions are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles ensuring that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks. Driving SME knowledge across Technology Risk roles within the bank to meet future needs. Requirements 15+ years of relevant experience in either a 1LoD or 2LoD risk management or risk consulting role. Job_Title: AVP, AML, Suspicious Transaction Reporting Officer, Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance
Job_Descriptions: AVP, AML, Suspicious Transaction Reporting Officer, Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance (GLRC) supports the Bank in all legal, regulatory and compliance matters. The division ensures that the Bank's businesses comply with policies, procedures and relevant laws, rules and regulations issued by Monetary Authority of Singapore and other local regulators. Apart from being a legal advisor on litigation, trademark filings and other legality issues where relevant, GLRC plays an important role as undertakers of the bank-wide regulatory compliance and anti-money laundering initiatives. This includes developing policies and procedures to manage and mitigate risks relating to money laundering and financing of terrorism, as well as monitoring, detection and combating of money laundering and financial crime activities. Key Responsibilities: Investigate all internal escalations on unusual transactions Conduct research through opened/closed source databases Advise business units / business compliance on STR related issues Document investigation findings File Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs) to the relevant Authorities within stipulated timeline Participate in AML related projects Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: A good university degree with min 4 years of relevant work experience. Ideal candidate should also have background in AML/CFT investigations and financial fraud. Candidate must possess strong attention to details, research, analytical and investigation skills Proficient in writing with strong communication and interpersonal skills. Self-driven with high level of initiative and follow-through skills. Able to work independently as well as in a team. Knowledge in banking products and experience working in a financial institution on AML / KYC/ anti-fraud related projects is an advantage. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Investment Banking, Classic, SEA Advisory Team, Analyst/ Associate, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Investment Banking, Classic, SEA Advisory Team, Analyst/ Associate, Singapore The Investment Banking Division Classic Coverage Team is looking for an Associate to be based in Singapore. Our Associates play an important role in developing and strengthening our client relationships, participating on our advisory teams and in structuring and executing a full range of financial transactions. Their responsibilities include creating and analyzing financial models, organizing and preparing client presentations, helping manage transaction processes, and assisting in structuring transactions. They will gain exposure to the firm's businesses and expand their knowledge of the investment banking industry, as they develop key analytical, communications and marketing skills. They organize and prepare presentations, which explain industry trends, assess clients' situations to provide the necessary financial advice, and recommend strategies to meet client goals. From maintaining client communication to helping Goldman Sachs structure client transactions, our Analysts/ Associates are a vital part of Goldman Sachs' banking team's investments. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree from top Business schools in a financial discipline. Minimum 2 years relevant experience from investment banking or equivalent experience. Experience working within IBD Excellent in English and fluency in another Southeast Asian language will be looked upon favorably to cover ASEAN clients, but not a necessity History of outstanding academic and professional achievement. Strong team orientation and a demonstrated ability to work effectively with team members in multiple groups and regions.

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President - Distribution Manager, Documentation - Commercial Banking - (0000GP0O)
Job_Descriptions: Some careers have more impact than others. If you're looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you'll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Global Trade and Receivables Finance comprises over 4,500 people across more than 60 countries, helping suppliers and buyers with their export and import finance needs. Trade is where HSBC began in 1865, when we financed commerce between Europe, North America and Asia. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an Assistant Vice President - Distribution Manager, Documentation. Principal Responsibilities Engaging with external parties on the negotiation of Risk Participation agreements and Non-Disclosure agreements Preparation of Transactional Offers for distributed transactions to Investors Collaboration with Internal stakeholders (Legal, Rel Mgrs, Bus Dev. Mgrs and GTRS Services) for execution of transactions Contribute to the implementation of new Distribution systems and processes Administration of Team Share point Requirements Minimum Bachelor's degree / Graduation or as required for the role, whichever is higher Background in dealing with negotiation of Risk Distribution agreements a distinct advantage Understand various industry standard agreements Ability to effectively review and negotiate Distribution agreement Should be able to work independently Understanding of GTRF products (Core Trade and Open account) will be an advantage Intermediate level experience of Microsoft applications i.e Excel PowerPoint To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You'll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

About the company: Crypto.com (CDC) was founded in 2016 on a simple belief: it's a basic human right for everyone to control their money, data and identity. With over 10 million users on its platform today, Crypto.com provides a powerful alternative to traditional financial services, turning its vision of "cryptocurrency in every wallet" into reality, one customer at a time. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013, ISO 27701:2019, PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and NIST CSF and PF Tier 4 maturity. Crypto.com is headquartered in Singapore with a 3,000+ strong global team. For more information, please visit www.crypto.com. About the Role We are looking to recruit a Finance Manager to support Crypto.com growing business in Singapore. The overall finance team is currently going through an exciting phase of transformation to support Crypto.com's high growth plans. The Finance Manager will be responsible to take ownership of all financial related matters, including the daily, month end tasks/year end close processes, as well be the primary point of contact to the business in South East Asia. This role offers the successful candidate a fantastic opportunity to help build the finance team by focusing on efficient and effective coordination, governance and execution of accurate financial reporting and providing key insights to the business while driving continuous process improvements. Main Requirements and Responsibilities Prepare and file financial statements, GST/VAT and tax returns; ensure all statutory reporting compliance requirements are met for Singapore and/or other APAC entities in a timely manner Co-ordinate with global finance team to complete month end process ensuring all journals are correctly processed, results are validated and accurate in a timely manner Distil complex financial data with clear and practical insight for business leaders and executives Be an effective finance business partner and the primary point of contact to key team members in the APAC business Strengthen internal control framework and finance process efficiencies and make recommendation to drive continuous operational excellence Support strategic financial analysis, including KPI benchmarking across various products line Liaise with external auditors, tax agents, banking partners, corporate secretary to ensure full statutory compliance Strong interaction and collaboration with global finance teams to ensure consistency in approach, tools and methodology Work with manager and finance teams to roll out new processes, initiatives, policies service enhancements Contribute towards other projects as required Requirements Relevant qualification/s with ACCA/CPA/CA Ideally 5+ years all rounded Finance experience with a Big 4 and/or fast paced MNC Background in a fast paced entrepreneurial or startup/technology environments coupled with crypto knowledge is highly advantageous Flexibility and ability to adapt to changing conditions and different culture Ability to craft and deliver clear, coherent, and concise messages to business leaders Detail oriented, analytical, with an ability to multitask in a high growth environment Self starter who is passionate about start-ups and the growth of digital assets Prior experience in Oracle NetSuite system is a definite advantage Benefits We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech. Flat team. Work side by side with the co-founding team Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team You will get to have involvement in developing a brand new product from scratch alongside with a talented team

Job_Descriptions: Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance Singapore As a Barclays Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance you will build confidence in our bank for today and for the future of finance. You will oversee the day-to-day Business Oversight Compliance (BOC) for the Corporate Banking businesses across APAC including: Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan. We are looking to grow the role where you also have the chance to collaborate closely with other members of the Private Side & Research Compliance team, in APAC, to assist with BOC coverage for Singapore's Private Bank and Investment Banking and Research businesses. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? You will initially be responsible for BOC compliance matters such as conduct risk and reputational risk for APAC Corporate Banking in Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan, Working with management and Ops Rigour teams to check and challenge embedment of controls by relevant policies and procedures to meet regulatory requirements Highlighting areas of concern relating to APAC Corporate Banking's embedment of the Enterprise Risk Management Framework in relation to conduct risk and reputational risk Delivering the conduct risk agenda and relevant training to the business Checking and challenging APAC Corporate Banking's risk assessments in relation to conduct risk and reputational risk Working with the Cross Border Compliance team to advise on regional cross border issues Working with relevant Country Compliance teams to advise the business on regulatory changes (alongside relevant Country Compliance) Assisting BOC for Singapore Private Bank, APAC Investment Banking and APAC Research What we're looking for: Carrying out duties in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays' policies and policy standards. University degree or equivalent industry experience Senior stakeholder management with all senior leadership across various countries across APAC Proven expertise and knowledge of Corporate Banking Compliance matters, analysing structured transactions and ensuring identify and investigate compliance issues Skills that will help you in the role: Experience in the legal or compliance departments of an international investment bank or large organisations Understands complex transactions and explains compliance issues clearly and concisely Ability to become familiar with new products and regulatory requirements Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritise and multi-task Where will you be working? Posted by: Jacylnn Tan Onsite Recruitment Lead View profile & contact 2022 Operations Trainee Academy Programme - Singapore Company Overview We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper. We're committed to investing sustainably and integrate Environment, Social and Corporate Governance (ESG) into our decision-making across all investments whilst maintaining long term performance for our clients. We can back this up with our impact measurement tool which combines measures of harm and good effect of companies to provide the overall social and environmental impact. Our Operations Team We support our global business by providing high quality and efficient operational oversight, processing and reporting across all of our business channels. Operations covers a broad spectrum of responsibilities from ensuring confirmation and settlement of trade activity, daily oversight of the funds Net Asset Value (NAV) to ensuring that we meet all of our Client, Fund and regulatory reporting obligations. It's a busy and dynamic area with many exciting opportunities to build and develop your career. The Base In Singapore, Schroders' presence dates back to the mid-1970s. Since then, we have successfully built a strong local franchise and are one of the largest asset management companies in Singapore today. We manage funds for a broad range of clients including official institutions, sovereign wealth funds, insurance companies, charities, government-linked companies, high net worth individuals and retail investors. Singapore is our Asia Pacific operations hub, providing operational oversight to other offices in the region such as Australia, Indonesia, Hong Kong and Japan. The team constantly seeks to develop and adopt innovative and collaborative solutions to bring the best results for our clients. The Programme You will join as a permanent employee and start your career in the Operations Academy before moving into a dedicated team.  Over the two-year programme, you will be rotated across a number of areas to give you an introduction into operations.  You will also have the opportunity to network and meet with the wider business groups, which will give you insight into the world of asset management. We want you to be innovative and creative in your approach in understanding what we do and how we do it. We will provide training throughout the two-year programme which will cover: aspects of the asset management industry via accredited learning to gain the Level 3 - Investment Operations Certificate; functional knowledge through a regular rotation into different teams; application training as part of the on-the-job experience; as well as non-functional training, such as organisation skills and written/verbal communication effectiveness, to help broaden your overall skills set. You will learn from experienced colleagues as they guide you through the various applications and processes which will allow you perform your role more efficiently. The knowledge, experience, and qualifications • Demonstrates strong communication skills and working well within a team environment. • Experience of prioritising workload, demonstrating a keen eye for detail, problem solving and confidence in communicating escalations when required. • Show great interpersonal and analytical skills. We will teach what you need to know about the job. We just need you to bring your drive, passion and enthusiasm to make the most of the opportunity. The candidate we are looking for We take pride in hiring the right people for our programmes. People who can hit the ground running and want to make a difference. • We look for people who are naturally curious about the world around them and who are eager to learn more about our industry and what we do. • We want someone who is not afraid to bring new ideas to the table • You are someone who is flexible and able to think independently, be proactive and an advocate for change • A team player with strong communication and collaboration skills are essential as you will work as part of a team to overcome challenges and share ideas. • A growth mindset: we understand you may make mistakes, and when you do, we are looking for you to learn from these • We want you to contribute to our continuously evolving culture, whether it's participating in our recreational clubs and campaigns or starting your own. Recruitment process 1.    Online application form and CV 2.    Online assessments 3.    Online video interview 4.    Assessment centre 5.    Final round interview Applications will close approximately 2-3 weeks before the assessment centre, but please note that we recruit on a rolling basis so we would recommend that you apply early.

Job_Title: Wealth Management - Client Service Executive - Associate / Assistant Vice President #WorkNow
Job_Descriptions: Details of the Division and Team: Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management business is one of the largest wealth managers worldwide. We offer our clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations, we create lasting value for clients. We specialize in developing bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate Bank, Investment Bank and DWS. We aim to become a highly competitive global wealth manager by combining financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships. As a growth business for Deutsche Bank, we contribute towards building a more balanced, less capital intensive and stable business model for the bank. The business are looking for a Client Service Executive to support the Relationship Managers (RMs) and Investment Managers (IMs) in the day to day servicing of clients through processing transactions, resolving account/payment problems and providing all round operational support. The role will sit in a centralized team reporting to a local manager. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday and flexible working arrangements Your key responsibilities: Support Private Banker to provide excellent service to high net-worth clients so as to achieve client retention, and be able to handle daily business-as-usual tasks within the desk and market Understanding of all desk administration and ability to manage the meetings and travel arrangements of Private Bankers Understand client requirements and assist Private Bankers in daily maintenance of account relationships Act as the client key interface over initiation of clients' instructions, monitor funds for payment, prepare clients' fax instructions, forms and loan disbursement instruction Ability to understand issues and appropriately escalate to Management in a timely fashion Develop good understanding of the governing regulatory framework, including but not limited to applicable confidentiality/secrecy/data protection regulations and cross border rules where relevant Your skills and experience: Strong team player, also able to meet tight deadlines and multi-task Self-motivated and goal orientated and a ‘can do’ personality, who is able to work in a high paced environment Fluent (written and oral) in English; other languages are a plus Meticulous, methodical and concise, with a strong attention to detail 7 or more years of relevant investment experience, coupled with a good sense of integrity Relevant local licenses and qualifications How we’ll support you: Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career About us and our teams: Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Job_Title: Global Tax Standards Subject Matter Expert
Job_Descriptions: Global Tax Standards Subject Matter Expert The Global Tax Standard team is a dynamic team of Business Analysts and Software Developers. We follow an agile process, working closely together as a team but also interacting with other related teams and clients to develop new product features and maintain existing ones in live use. The team is the owner of functionality around Withholding Taxes, US QI and FATCA Reporting, Automatic Exchange of Information (CRS), Generic Tax Statements for offshore clients (including capital gain calculation), Swiss Taxes and other highly flexible Tax Reporting Tools used by our clients. Your mission as member of this global team will be to Analyze, design, and parameterize the functionalities to implement business solutions for Global Tax topics (hands-on on software based Avaloq Core System) Manage the daily BAU queries, fix the defects and support the Users for Global Tax Reporting. Manage and implement Avaloq Banking System upgrades and new-feature development. Support global and local projects implementing changes on the team's functionalities This job represents a unique opportunity to advance your problem solving and technical skills, while also to acquiring banking know how on a top level. You are encouraged to acquire more detailed and interdisciplinary knowledge about other areas in our banking system, becoming an expert of our core banking software and the corresponding business processes in the industry. Degree qualifications, preferably in IT / Computer Science related disciplines At least 5 years of relevant experience, preferably in the IT / Financial Services industry Experience in the business aspects of Global Taxation like CRS , FATCA & US QI Reporting, WHT Knowledge of Developer tools (ICE, SQL Developer) Knowledge of the Avaloq Object Modelling and Parameterization concepts (Rule tables, Report writer, Order Validations, Base Parameters) are a very strong advantage Excellent analytical and technical skills Team oriented and good communication skills to closely collaborate with customers and colleagues globally. Cultural awareness and experience in working in Singapore / Asia and openness to work in a global team with members around the globe

Candidate Acquisition Manager Candidate Acquisition Manager Singapore As a Barclays Candidate Acquisition Manager, you will support our Talent Acquisition team in attracting candidates from Early Careers through to Senior Executives. This will be achieved by support our hiring community through our selection, assessment and offer processes, empower colleagues to plan and manage their careers. Reporting to the Regional Head of Programmatic Recruitment, you will be responsible for driving APAC candidate acquisition activity for Corporate & Investment Banking (CIB). Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Driving APAC CIB candidate acquisition activity for all Programmatic channels; including Interns, Graduate and Apprentices as it relates to our events and assessment strategies Partnering with the business and working in conjunction with Programmatic Planning teams Agreeing and attending a calendar of events associated with attraction to all Programmatic channels including campus, recruitment events and school events Developing, implementing attraction and assessment efforts that are in line with both firm goals and individual pathway goals Educating stakeholders on our recruitment strategy, value proposition, and engage them in our efforts Designing an impactful and integrated candidate attraction strategy based on data analysis and a deep knowledge of universities/organizations Evaluating Return on Investment (ROI) on events and use information to inform future decisions/recommendations Designing and executing assessment processes that will achieve firm goals while allowing for all Programmatic channels to effectively source for individualized programming What we're looking for: Japanese speaking is preferred as the role requires interaction with Japanese stakeholders Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to interact across all levels, with both internal and external stakeholders Creative thinker with an ability to continuously evaluate and improve candidate outreach and assessment processes Ability to consolidate and synthesize information across business lines to effectively and consistently communicate the regional acquisition efforts Skills that will help you in the role: Effective people management skills, and able to coach and drive a team Preferable knowledge of regional end to end recruitment processes Strong MS Office Packages including both PowerPoint and Excel Strategically able to shape a compelling narrative and plan for recruiting candidates Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Job_Title: International Personal Bank (IPB) Manager’s Control Assessment (MCA) Transformation Analyst
Job_Descriptions: International Personal Bank (IPB) Manager’s Control Assessment (MCA) Transformation Analyst Overview Citi's Global Consumer Business Operational Risk and Controls (CBORC) organization drives global consistency for addressing Operational Risk and Control issues in the Global Consumer Bank. CBORC fosters a culture of control and customer centricity and accountability by leading efforts to identify, anticipate and mitigate regulatory, reputational, and operational risks. This role is responsible for supporting the Country CBORC Head in the restructuring, simplification, and streamlining of the MCA Program through implementation of effective control design and monitoring strategies to create a robust, comprehensive, and sustainable risk and controls management and monitoring framework. You will be an integral part of Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) Transformation as one of the 8 key priorities to support delivery of current regulatory commitments and support execution of the transformation agenda. You will drive the effective oversight of Country Consumer Management Governance Entity and Assessment Unit architecture, and the implementation of standardized Consumer specific content from Standard MCA Profiles covering Consumer Products, Processes, Operations and related functions including Data Analytics, Digital Channels and Client Experience and Digital Sales & Marketing, etc. You will be responsible to work through the country level implementation of GRC Program Transformation Road Map as laid out by the global teams. You will collaborate with Regional and Country MCA content owners and business process owners and support the identification, design, documentation and assessment of the quality of suites of Key Controls, Monitoring/Assessment mechanisms to mitigate significant operational risk types for Country Consumer. As a First Line of Defense you will need to build trusted relationships with Business Leaders, Process Owners, Regional CBORC colleagues as well as Second and Third Line partners. This role is part of the Country CBORC team and reports to the Country Consumer MCA Lead. Responsibilities Support the implementation of Quality Control (QC) program for MCA and deliver on MCA data normalization and stabilization in a sustainable manner. Support the implementation of a framework to assess the quality and consistency of control and monitoring statements on a sustained basis. Work on remediation efforts for improvements to MCA data quality in line with Control and Monitoring design assessment principles, including rationalization and optimization of ARCMs from a simplification standpoint. Work with SMEs and countries to monitor and track embedding Key Automated Application Controls (KAACs), Regulatory Mandatory Addendum (RMA) and Digital Monitoring Tools (DMTs) within MCA. Support an operating rhythm of data analysis for senior management reporting of MCA outputs for country consumer governance and oversight. Track timely completion of key MCA activities. Thematic checks from time to time on quality of MCA execution including mapping of issues to ARCMs, quality of documentation, quality of monitoring and testing. Participate in CitiRisk and Controls (CRC) system design initiatives including UATs and monitoring of key system related issues impacting users. Support Country Consumer MGE Quarterly Risk Assessments (QRAs) and Annual Risk Assessments (ARAs) related activities. Assist in identifying automation opportunities from MCA data via data analytics and work with relevant SMEs to drive the execution of automation for controls and monitoring and embedding them into MCA. Where appropriate, assist with the development of thematic testing/assessment of Key Control suites based on Standard MCA Profile (SMP) and Enterprise MCA Profile (EMP) content. Support the re-engineering of key processes to deliver best in class standardized, streamlined and simplified capabilities across the organization. Competencies/Skills Risk professional with exceptional career within consumer banking risk management. Proven experience in process simplification, reengineering and automation efforts. Track record of installation of improvement programs and processes. Good knowledge of Consumer Operations and Consumer product offering, services, policies, procedures, regulations, systems, and technologies. Knowledge of various risks faced by the business and ability to define risk management mechanisms within the organization. Ability to drive results. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong influencing and negotiation skills. Ability to explore alternatives and positions to reach outcomes that are supported and accepted by various parties. Proactive and Dynamic with a strategic mindset. Able to identify and resolve issues quickly and effectively. Ability to work effectively in situations requiring analytical, interpretive and problem solving techniques. Qualifications Degree level or similar Controls qualifications desirable Accomplished professional with 6+ years of experience in Risk & Control in a large financial institution. Experience using risk and control systems (i.e. CitiRisk and Controls) Experience in working in a truly global business Demonstrable ability in partnering across multi-functional organizations to bring about change in a specialize function or capability Job Family Group: Compliance and Control Job Family: Business Control Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. Job_Title: CWM, PWM, Wealth Management Professional - Analyst / Associate - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: CWM, PWM, Wealth Management Professional - Analyst / Associate - Singapore Consumer and Wealth Management (CWM) Across Consumer and Wealth Management (CWM), Goldman Sachs helps empower clients and customers around the world reach their financial goals. Our advisor-led wealth management businesses provide financial planning, investment management, banking and comprehensive advice to a wide range of clients, including ultra-high net worth and high net worth individuals, as well as family offices, foundations and endowments, and corporations and their employees. Our consumer business provides digital solutions for consumers to better spend, borrow, invest, and save. Across CWM, our growth is driven by a relentless focus on our people, our clients and leading-edge technology, data and design. PWM Goldman Sachs Private Wealth Management (PWM) specializes in creating comprehensive wealth management plans for high net worth individuals and families, as well as select institutions, including foundations and endowments. PWM Teams work one-on-one with clients to advise and deliver customized strategies drawn from our deep investment experience, diverse wealth management capabilities and global reach. Our Private Wealth Advisors (PWAs) deliver an unparalleled investment platform inclusive of the full product and service offerings of Goldman Sachs and beyond, which may include tax and estate planning, philanthropic planning and private banking and lending services. As client needs evolve, this close relationship allows the team to offer complementary services and new opportunities by leveraging the resources of Goldman S As a Wealth Management Professional, your responsibilities include: Serve as the liaison for clients regarding inquiries and provides team support Analyze and monitor client portfolios, and assist with other aspects of managing a client relationship Drive and complete a number of compliance requirements and control related functions Assist clients with asset transfers Assist the teams with execution of trades (primarily in FX and Cash deposits) Handle cash management, foreign exchange transactions, currency hedging and money markets trades Assist teams in subscribing hedge funds, private equity funds and GSAM funds Assist on projects related to platform development and other infrastructure issues Handle margin related requests and queries; liaise with various operations and technology teams for day to day support Partner with operations on all account opening / maintenance matters, including various remediation efforts. Basic Qualifications 2 to 6 years of relevant experience Bachelor degree Ability to work in a fast-paced environment within a team-oriented structure Ability to work and think clearly under pressure Team player Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Outlook, Excel and Word) Mandarin required due to client coverage SG CACS Paper 1 & 2 (must be obtained within 90 days of employment) ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers . We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. We are hiring Data Specialists who have knowledge and experience in data classification and data taxonomy to fill the role of a data classification specialist. Identify key fields needed for classification and translate classification requirements into configurable rules and logics in BigID and define a centralised process that governs maintenance of the configurable rules and logics in BigID. Organise test activities to validate and fine tune configurable rules and logics in BigID. Maintain documentation for the classification rules and logics as well as the standard taxonomy. Job Requirements: University graduate from Information Technology, Data Science, Knowledge Management, or an equivalent discipline. Certified agile professional with work experience in the banking industry is preferred. Experience in one or more industrial taxonomy or ontology standards is advantage. Knowledge in Information Cyber Security, Data Privacy, Record Management, Data Sovereignty, and Data Subject Rights is advantage. Excellent communication skills. Be able to articulate business concepts and definitions concisely, accurately and clearly.

The CISO candidate must be able to present to multiple audiences including external customers and client. Critical measurements through developed KPIs reporting to the GRC team will also define business adoption to the Security framework governing State Street. What we value: Serve as key Security contact for the APAC region leadership team. Collaborate with Global Cyber Security and assigned business partner teams to ensure the business aligns plans addressing security policies in their products and services. Work across the BISO Organization to appropriate shared success solutions. An ability to motivate and manage a team of information security staff supporting the organization's goals and an ability to lead the process of developing an information security vision for the future. An ability to cultivate and build collaborative working relationships with a broad range of enterprise stakeholders Ability to weigh the relative costs and benefits of potential actions and identify the most appropriate one Drive change through the ability to effectively influence others to modify their opinions, plans, or behaviors. Communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, orally and in writing, in an easily-understood, authoritative, and actionable manner Consistently display working knowledge of the following areas of technical expertise: information policy formulation, information security management, business risk management, IT risk assessment and management. Communication laterally and upwards the business temperament to security requirements. Create visibility through effective security and risk metrics and reporting. Build budget in conjunction with needs to ensure success of the implementation of security within the regional area. Execute the implementation of Global Cyber Security strategies and tactics aligned to key State Street risk and business needs. Create and deliver effective presentations as a means for communicating project and deliverable progress. Provide regular status updates to the SVP, GRC on business dealings affecting Security. Build and nurture positive working relationships with clients with the intention to exceed client expectations. Work cross-functionally with team members to support and drive a collaborative team environment down through the BISO community. Job_Title: Aladdin Business, Implementation Specialist, Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Aladdin Business, Implementation Specialist, Vice President Description About this role About this role: The Aladdin Business is growing rapidly, with the volume and complexity of new client deals and strategic partnerships growing each year. We are at the next phase of our growth and are evolving into a platform focused business with multiple new product launches and external partnerships. Successful candidates will join in our efforts to help sophisticated investors onboard the world's leading end-to-end operating system for investment portfolios to see their whole portfolio, understand risk exposures, and act with precision. We are looking to hire an Associate/ Vice President candidate with a focus on investment operations who has the depth of expertise in various investment operations functions such as trade confirmation, trade settlement, corporate actions processing, cash and holdings reconciliations, derivative operations, etc. Trading expertise and knowledge of connectivity with electronic trading platforms is a plus Your team: The Aladdin Implementation Team is responsible for the installation and deployment of Aladdin and related products and services, globally. Aladdin Implementations, including both institutional and retail assignments, are high profile initiatives that require team members to have senior level exposure and play an active role in redefinition of investment organizations. A typical implementation is at least as much about processes and implementing change as it is about investments & technology. We help clients achieve ambitious strategic objectives, which range from streamlining investment operations to integrating teams, to unifying their investment analytics & risk reporting framework, to modernizing their overall investment process. BlackRock's implementation model is unique in the sense that we take full responsibility for the Client going live on our solution. It also means that we develop true partnerships with our clients at the most senior levels, which continue to grow post go live. Your responsibilities: Understand client objectives and goals paired with strong emotional ownership to deliver on solutions utilizing Aladdin capabilities Engage the Client's key leaders to understand, redesign, and deploy strategic business workflows across the full spectrum of the investment cycle, including pre-trade decisioning, order management, trading, investment operations, risk management/compliance/oversight, closed-book accounting, or performance measurement & attribution Collaborate closely with the Client's senior management team (e.g. Head of Investment Operations, Chief Technology Officer, Chief Investment Officer) and provide strong leadership throughout the Aladdin implementation Work directly with the Client to create and administer the implementation project plan, as well as the coordination of resources across multiple functional areas Lead and document investment and operational workflow design sessions for various asset classes, including equities, fixed income, alternatives, derivatives, and related workflows Gain an in-depth knowledge of Aladdin functionality and workflows, as well as industry expertise (e.g., pensions, insurers, asset managers) to ensure clients take full advantage of the suite of Aladdin products and workflows Lead, coordinate, and assist in client-specific Aladdin configuration, testing and user training Work closely with the Client and Aladdin Product Managers to support client development needs Work closely with the Client and key internal functional teams to ensure the full range of capabilities are considered during an Aladdin implementation to ensure standard methodologies are achieved Participate in Aladdin business development activities, assisting in platform demonstrations, implementation pre-planning, or client due diligence, as a product/workflow subject matter authority Actively manage client communications regarding Aladdin product changes and configurations, as related to Aladdin onboarding Aid in developing improved practices to make the Implementation model more efficient with each new implementation Develop strong relationships within BlackRock Solutions and BlackRock to ensure the best client experience Your qualifications: Deep understanding of investment operations and trading as a provider or practitioner, with 6-10 years of relevant industry experience. Knowledge in investment accounting will be useful. Experience with order management systems, electronic trading platforms, trade processing platforms or derivative platforms Experience implementing scalable and repeatable business processes Excellent interpersonal skills with proven ability to build relationships with internal and client senior management Superior communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts simply and clearly to clients Well organized with the ability to manage several priorities with a hands-on approach Strong familiarity with capital markets instruments (equities, fixed income, private markets, derivatives), either analytically or via strong knowledge of investment life cycle Excellent creative, analytical and computer skills with an entrepreneurial approach to large, complex projects, and ability to execute autonomously Enjoys a fast paced, high-intensity and complex environment, troubleshooting time critical issues and working with people Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong attention to detail; willing to take proactive action, and desire to roll up sleeves Expected to travel periodically, including international opportunities Nice if you have: Track record of leading successful implementations of investment technology solutions (order/trading systems, operations tools) Working experience in investment risk management, fixed-income, equity and derivative markets and solid understanding of the investment lifecycle. Programming background or experience with query languages desired Served as a provider or market practitioner in the areas of portfolio management, trading, investment operations, investment accounting, risk management, or data warehousing Understanding of investment risk (e.g., sustainability analytics, market risk analytics) Familiarity with buy-side institutional investment management process Experience with platform integrations (e.g., interfaces, APIs) Line management experience Project management experience (e.g., PMP) MBA, CFA, or FRM preferred SQL, Python, VBA experience a plus Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.
