Job_Title: NEXT Digital Consulting - Senior Digital Consultant (Smart Spaces)
Job_Descriptions: See job description for details NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 49 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation. For more information, visit ncs.co. Unprecedented adoption of new digital technologies such as mobility, analytics, cloud and internet of things, has sparked off changes across many aspects of human life and industries. These are further bolstered by advancements in complementary technologies such as augmented/ virtual reality, cognitive systems and robotics. But technology is not an end in itself, rather just a way to improve the operations and achieve business value. It is our job in consulting to make the necessary connection between business and IT. In other words, to answer the question "how is this technology helping the users do their best work?". To do this the consultant will need to bridge business requirements to digital technologies and IT requirements, through digital consulting services (from pre-sales to delivery). Specifically, in the area of smart spaces: to achieve the outcomes of sustainability of physical assets (e.g. buildings, infrastructure), productivity of workers and seamless physical-digital experiences of space occupants (e.g. visitors, workers, operators). The Senior Digital Consultant will participate in the delivery of digital transformation consulting projects, as part of a team or working independently. Planning, collaborating across various business units and internal teams, as well as client and partners. Conducting market landscape and stakeholder analysis to develop point-of-views. Supporting pre-sales activities, including proposal and presentation preparations and client engagement work. Applying appropriate frameworks, methodologies such as Design Thinking and Lean principles in workshop facilitation, to elicit understanding of problems and to drive innovation and transformation. Developing business concepts and identifying digital technologies to enable and transform business operations. Assessing impact of change and building digital roadmaps. Developing innovative business solutions and identifying digital technology solutions to address clients' needs and transform their business operations. Developing future state digital business concepts. Conducting impact assessment and to develop, a roadmap to realise the envisioned future state. In Smart Spaces: Identifying the relevant technologies required to collect, sense-make, automate, analyse, visualise, sustain and collaborate to make spaces 'smart' Developing the digital infrastructure blueprint, including IT infrastructure as well as the integration points to other services. Recommending maintenance operations models and contractual models. Additionally: Supporting the Consulting Practice Lead in new initiatives or special projects to continually develop the consulting practice or business development of NCS. The ideal candidate should have or possess: Construction or physical space design experience MEP (Mechanical, Electrical & Plumping) and IT integration design experience Building management: At least 1 cycle of building management system implementation At least 1 cycle of physical security system implementation Consulting: At least 2-year exposure in providing smart spaces consulting / advisory services to customers (e.g. from strategy development, data gathering, analysis/ synthesis, problem solving to making recommendations and helping to facilitate customer decision making). Proficient in some (if not all) of the techniques and tools in market analysis, business case and innovation such as design thinking. EXCELLENT BUSINESS ACUMEN AND ANALYSIS SKILLS, logical thinking and common sense. Being able to analyse a problem from multiple perspectives, use different perspectives to analyse a problem, know which tools or methods to apply, establish connections and relationships, identify a clear hierarchy of ideas, challenge assumptions, identify key points... EXCELLENT COMMUNICATION SKILLS (written and oral). Structure ideas clearly, create written or graphical material which is clear, structured and concise, and 100% grammatically correct. Good interpersonal skills to interact with stakeholders across all levels of an organisation, technical or business oriented Real, genuine wish to learn something new every day, to work creatively and to intelligently challenge assumptions Uncomfortable with "good enough" Self-motivated with a positive "can-do" attitude Honesty and integrity

Job_Title: Treasury & Trade Solutions APAC Commercial Cards Product and Risk Manager
Job_Descriptions: Treasury & Trade Solutions APAC Commercial Cards Product and Risk Manager – Vice President Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions ("TTS") is a leading provider of cash management, treasury and trade solutions to Financial Institutions, Public Sector and Corporate clients around the world. TTS Global Commercial Cards is a leading commercial cards issuer with the largest global proprietary network, successfully serving the needs of large local and multinational organizations for more than 40 years with over 14,000 commercial card programs, 6 million cardholders and approximately US$42+ billion in annual charge volume globally.The Commercial Cards business supports comprehensive and digital cards solutions across Travel, B2B and VCA, Purchasing, and Meeting & Events to Citi’s institutional clients. Commercial Cards business in Asia represents over 13 countries with 200+ employees across product, sales, implementation, client service and operations. The business is expected to continue to be a major engine of growth in Asia with focus on digital solutions, business to business opportunities, e-commerce and the commercialization of product capabilities and origination of new business. Momentum is strong with revenues having doubled over the last few years. The position will be part of the APAC product team of the TTS Commercial Card and will be responsible for key product management and risk management in the business. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for Commercial Cards Product Management, Risk and Project Management Work with internal partners across Treasury & Trade Solutions (TTS), Institutional Clients Group (ICG), and the Functional Partners – globally, regionally and in country to drive the growth of cards within the broader B2B space. Participate actively in Global and Regional initiatives and work groups representing Commercial Cards business. Oversee the product strategy for a portfolio of B2B commercial card solutions and services, including traditional Purchasing Card solutions as well as emergent solutions. Lead key projects for commercial cards business across the region. Excellent organizational and management skills and possessesa natural capabilityto monitor and track a huge number of tasks. Oversight on Outsourcing & New Product activities of the cards product. Support requests for management reviews and audit deliverables and documentation Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy Owns centralized activities, metrics, and controls for Cards governance entity at the regional level. Manage the quarterly, semi-annual, and annual attestation of the completeness and accuracy of the Cards governance entity. Manage risk & control management across risk stripes, particularly operational, regulatory, AML/ Sanctions risk for TTS Commercial cards product, process & systems. KEY COMPETENCIES / SKILLS Business/Industry knowledge/competencies Strong understanding of Product Management, Risk management and Control framework within Citi will be an important asset. Good understanding of TTS products and services, preferably Cards. An understanding of the Cards ecosystem, track record of partnership and collaboration with Operations and Technology. Track record of product or client management disciplines. The successful candidate must be both a leader and a team player, working with regional Product teams, functional partners, and functional teams globally Personal Attributes/Interpersonal skills Excellent presentation, communication, and analytical skills Strong collaboration skills, interpersonal and stakeholder management skills Drive for outcome and focus on execution Strong work ethic, positive attitude and strive for continuous self-improvement Ability to prioritize and work under pressure Organization savvy and professionalism; Collaborative Strong relationship skills to manage external and internal stakeholders Strong analytical skills to identify and prioritize key risks and recommend adequate corrective actions Adaptability and dynamism given the evolution of the Cards Business Ability and willingness to think “out of the box” and question the “status quo” Stakeholder management. The role will involve engagement with product management team, business managers, operations, Independent Risk Management function, and other 2nd and 3rd line functions at the regional and global level. Regional/Country/Global TTS teams – Product, Sales, Countries, ICRM, AML/Sanctions, Legal, Compliance, Credit Risk, Operations, and Technology and other global risk functions. QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE REQUIRED Undergraduate / Post graduate degree in Business, Finance or Economics or other commercial disciplines 8+ years of work experience in the financial services industry, preferably with experience in Transaction Banking and Cards ecosystem TTS product knowledge and country/regional product management experience Proven track record of successful product management Influencing/Collaboration skills KEY BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS Internal Regional/Country/Global TTS teams – Sales, Product, Services, Implementation and Operations Functional partners: Relationship Managers, Legal, AML, Credit Risk, Compliance, Operations, Technology, Country IBC, etc. External (on the need basis) Clients, Partners like Visa, MasterCard, Gemalto, Sykes, Hexaware

Drip.AI invites applications for the position of polymer chemist (full time) Drip.AI is a start-up company working in atmospheric water harvesting based on novel thermoresponsive hydrogels. The process is a combination of water absorption using the hygroscopic materials, evaporation by using the heat from sun light and condensation based on photothermal materials properties. Key Responsibilities: • Development of photo thermal heating systems using the sun light based on photothermal materials or using focused lenses or any other techniques. • Development of prototypes and design of product for water production from humid air using sun light. • Collect data for water absorption, evaporation and condensation rates under sun light in different locations around Singapore. • Process the data and present it in a scientific way. • Help in writing of patents and scientific white papers. Job Requirements: • Master or PhD in mechanical or material science engineering or any equivalent related subjects. • Have a knowledge about heat transfer concepts and photo thermal materials • Basic knowledge of solar heating and solar heat conversion. • Good knowledge of CAD software like Solid works or AutoCAD. • Good knowledge of photo thermal materials synthesis and hydrogels. • Materials characterizations and preparations (FTIR, XRD, UV-VIS, TGA, DSC, NMR,……) Interested applicants are invited to send full CV to *******@drip-ai.com We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Hiring Company: Drip.AI (https://www.drip-ai.com/), prefer singaporean or PR residing in Singapore.

Job_Title: First VP, Decision Management Team Lead, Group Retail
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department Division Decision Management Solution is part of the wider Risk and Decision Management (R&DM) Division that is responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring risk and decision management models for UOB's Group Retail Bank. 'Analytics Support & Decision Management Solution' team has been set up to execute the initiatives to (1) equip R&DM team members with the right tools, e.g. analytics tool, data, infrastructure, and (2) support the enabling of analytics to the users within Group Retail segment. The Bank implemented the Decision Management Solution ('DMS'), for Singapore and regional subsidiaries (Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia). The DMS Team Lead role will lead the Group DMS Team to drive and develop the rules configuration & framework, for Business as Usual (BAU) quarterly policy changes, scorecard project changes and guide Implementation Projects on DMS solution for both Singapore & subsidiaries. Job Responsibilities Role's main areas as follows: 1) Rules Deployment: Manage DMS Configuration team (functional specialists) for rules deployment (from Change Requests Analysis, execute changes (configuration), test planning & execution). 2) Rules Development & Framework: Guide DMS Configuration team to manage design & development of DMS rules framework and codes 3) Manage 'DMS change prioritization forum': As the solution supports various types of rules (e.g. business rules, credit / overlay rules, and scorecard rules), for multiple stakeholders, with different requirements and urgency. DMS team lead will facilitate deliberation among stakeholders. 4) Solution Governor of DMS solution: this role will handle administrative/ process matters (e.g. set up solution governance framework), system custodian functions and enhancements to the solution (e.g. change to the data platform, version upgrade). This requires he/she to work with vendor and IT, including project support for the DMS upgrade Y2022-Y2023. - Provide support to AS Head on development of DMS team and DMS related infrastructure framework - Manage DMS prioritization forum to deliberate on the Change Requests, Projects and issues pertaining to DMS, to drive discussion and issues resolution. - Responsible for DMS rules deployment - planning, executing, testing and monitoring. To oversee the team for design & development of DMS rules framework and codes, used for both Singapore and subsidiaries - Identify improvement areas and provide recommendations to users and Head of AS team. - DMS Governor - maintenance of DMS rules configuration ~ Establish governance process, e.g. ensuring entry / exit criteria, maker/checker & code review process are in place ~ Drive & lead 'DMS prioritization forum' (current monthly CR meeting with stakeholders o Empower functional specialists to perform analysis to facilitate the discussion / decision process & recommend proposals. Team Lead will review their analysis and findings for solution/ effective change implementation o Drive forum to prioritize Change Requests with different stakeholders o Present to stakeholders and/or senior management on the assigned topics o Oversee and coordinate DMS changes e.g. change of data model, version upgrade, release plan. o Owner of DMS Change request inventory and provide regular update /tracking. ~ Owner of DMS artefacts (e.g. Rules specification, Code release/version inventory, audit or IT documents, process inventory) - Rules deployment - manage team for development & deployment release for followings o Develop & maintain DMS configuration specification o Translate business requirements to configuration specifications through close interactions with business users and solving the business problem o Perform DMS configuration and DMS-UAT testing /support o Develop and maintain relevant documents (e.g. test scope, test plan, test scenarios, test results, and entry / exit criteria) o Provide an update to Analytics Support Head on progress and issues - Provide advisory and lead support (as 'Group role') to the regional team - Provide regular updates to Head of R&DM and senior management on key developments and issues - Lead discussions and issues resolution process including cross function projects with digital Bank (TMRW) or strategic programs in the Bank. Lead or participate to support the Credit Portfolio Management Program (CPM) for vendor evaluation, review solution design and RFP evaluation for similar rules decision engine for regional customer management module. Job Requirements - Undergraduate degree in a relevant program - Good Project management background; with experience in planning, dependencies management, risk / issues management, and stakeholder management - Experience in Rules Development & Coding with Experian solution for Credit Origination (PCSM) / Customer Management (PCCM) will be preferred. Experience in Decision Management Engine (e.g. Blaze, Triad ) is added advantage - 6 to 8 years' related experience in retail credit portfolio / policies management. Consulting and risk vendor experiences will be considered - Exposure to IT systems and implementation projects o Appreciation of the System Development Life Cycle and project management methodologies, to perform and/or develop team on business analysis, business process mapping and user requirements gathering o Able to assess upstream and downstream impact from changes - Self-starter, flexible with a proven record in people / Team management - Able to perform in a non-structured environment. - Strong interpersonal skills. Able to interact effectively with a diverse group of people, including senior management, business managers and technical people - Experience in Retail Credit underwriting, credit policy and digitalization of credit application process will be advantage - Proficiency in tools like SQL, Relational Database and experience in Credit Decision Analytical Data Management will be a plus - Experience in JAVA language or Business Rules Engine code development will be a plus, and good knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) /Artificial Intelligence (AI) driven solution for Credit Underwriting processing and Data Analytics Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. Job_Title: Citi TTS - Trade Asset Distribution Transactor (Vice President) - [21410164]
Job_Descriptions: Trade is part of Trade and Treasury Solutions and is one of the market leaders in providing Trade products to our corporate, PS and FI client base. An integral part of Trade’s growth strategy is our market leading ability to risk defease and distribute Trade assets. Trade Risk Distribution manages all activities related to the distribution, syndication, sell-down and insurance of risks related to "Trade" products, and the process of transferring / selling these risks, in order to achieve credit, cross-border, or balance sheet relief which is critical for the following reasons: (a) maintain a liquid asset book (b) achieve superior portfolio returns (c) manage asset levels (d) undertake large ticket transactions (e) overcome credit / cross-border / capital constraints The transactor would be an integral part of the Trade Asset Distribution team responsible for deal execution to achieve above objective on transaction and portfolio level basis Key Responsibilities: Distribution and risk defeasance of all trade asset classes: The person will be responsible for identification of the different avenues to defease risk related to a trade asset and execute the most optimal form of defeasance based on business needs Understanding of the different avenues of defeasance available including distribution, insurance, multilateral programs etc. Internal alignment with country / product / sale counterparts on what needs to be sold on specialized areas i.e Supplier & Receivable Finance FI (LCs and Loans), Export Agency Finance Fundamental ability to understand underlying Trade transaction and to communicate clearly to investors. Communicating with investors on transaction basis regarding specific transaction to be distributed Defeasance feedback / assessment: Provide up to date and timely feedback to the origination team on market pricing and appetite for trade assets. Conduct market reads for specific deals where necessary Managing "originate-to-distribute", trade structuring, clubs and syndications deals. Understand and negotiate legal documentation with counterparties (investors, insurers, multilaterals among others) Ensure that all asset sales adhere to Citi policy standard and any product programs which have been approved for use Foster a strong "one team" mentality and interact with key business stakeholders Contribute to the development of internal distribution systems such as T3 Qualifications: 6-10 years of experience Credit Risk and Trade Product experience Capital Markets Credit Risk Structuring or Credit Risk Management Experience Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Job_Title: Technology Incident & Change Management, Associate | Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Technology Incident & Change Management, Associate | Singapore Description About this role About BlackRock: BlackRock is one of the world's preeminent asset management firms and an outstanding provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary and individual investors around the world. Your team: Come work with us at one of the world's top FinTech companies! The Command Center and Control team runs Incident, Problem and Change Management processes ensuring the stability of the Aladdin platform while supporting a fast pace of innovation for BlackRock and our external clients. Your role and Impact: You will be responsible for managing some of the most critically important production incidents and technologically sophisticated changes in the industry. An individual in this role will have the opportunity to build relationships with Business and Technology teams across the region and globe through exposure to financial market workflows, applications, and technologies both crafted and adopted by BlackRock. This role will put one in a position to develop the overarching knowledge of how several teams collaborate to deliver services to end users and drive business impact lead by a culture of preparedness and quality. A successful candidate will support Aladdin, seek critical business-impacting incidents and lead communication between business groups during production impacting incidents, communicate the impact of high-risk changes and releases to technology and business partners while securing approvals and consensus from the Change Advisory Board. This position is also responsible for coordinating security patching across the technology infrastructure including working early shifts or working weekends (both on a rotational basis) to support patch implementation with the mission to achieve the firm's compliance and security goals. You have: The candidate is encouraged to have proven knowledge and experience in all parts of the IT delivery life cycle. We are seeking talent that has a passion for technical troubleshooting, thinks in an innovative way, values teamwork, has emotional ownership, and will go above and beyond to help develop the company. Our team has wide and multifaceted abilities, but we would encourage applications from candidates with the following skills: 4+ years of experience in a production/application support or client services role; financial services a plus Experience operating within an ITIL framework Background in supporting critically important applications Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent demands Basic technical skills in the following areas - desktop technology, TCP/IP networking, UNIX commands, SQL queries, and an understanding of SDLC Excellent oral and written communication skills. Good interpersonal skills and attention to detail Ability to work both independently and as part of a team effort Quick learner who will learn new systems or processes, highly motivated individual who takes full ownership of responsibilities Your advantages: Knowledge of security standard methodologies, operating system patching, and CVEs Experience and knowledge of change control principles, methodologies, and tools Knowledge of cloud computing platforms like Azure, AWS, etc. and understanding of different service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) Scripting or basic development language skills to automate common tasks We are a global but close-knit team of individuals who share a common goal of providing the very best possible level of support to our business partners and customers. From the top of the firm down, we embrace the diversity of values, identities and ideas brought by our employees. We are serious about our people and offer Flexible Time Off, collaborative working spaces and several other benefits. If any of this excites you, we would love to speak to you! Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. Technical Engineer (Desktop, Network), Analyst Description About this role About the role: You can work with us at one of the world's top FinTech companies. We sell our Aladdin platform to over 200 of the top global corporations. We are a global but close-knit team of individuals who share a common goal of providing the very best possible level of support to our business partners and customers. From the top of the firm down, we embrace the diversity of values, identities and ideas brought by our employees. We are serious about our people and offer Flexible Time Off, collaborative working spaces and a number of other benefits. We have a wide and multifaceted stack and skillset, but we're particularly interested in meeting people with skills in some of the following: Strong Leadership, Data-driven Analysis, Linux, Networking Concepts, Distributed Databases, and Cloud Platform offerings like Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS, and Google. We are looking for someone with a strong background in supporting mission-critical applications, a track record in outstanding service delivery across infrastructure and problem-solving. Team Overview: Platform Client Engagement (PCE) is part of the Platform Services group within BlackRock's Aladdin Product Group. Platform Services enhances our client's experience through a scalable hub for Operational Support, Client Engagement and Control across the Aladdin Platform. Platform Services supports over 200 external organizations that leverage Aladdin through BlackRock Solutions (BRS) offerings ( https://www.blackrock.com/aladdin/home ). PCE plays a crucial role liaising between our Aladdin business and the Aladdin platform providing technical support for Aladdin clients, owning the technical implementation of Aladdin at new BRS clients and providing business development support and management of projects for client technology requirements. PCE is a fast-paced team operating in a dynamic environment and provides the right individual with challenging work and an opportunity to lead cross functional groups in achieving a wide variety of objectives. Job Purpose / Responsibilities: The candidate will work across functions within PCE to provide leadership and mentorship to accomplish the team's strategic goals. In this role, PCE develops strong working relationships with BRS relationship managers and teams across the Aladdin Product Group. Aladdin Client Technical Support and Technical Initiatives Provide second level troubleshooting of client technical issues. Coordinate the technology implementation for new BRS Aladdin clients. Coordinate maintenance and support of client connectivity Additional technical work in support of the Aladdin business Additional Opportunities Due to the dynamic nature of the environment, PCE provides the opportunity for team members to participate across several functions, including Disaster Recovery planning for Aladdin, working with development teams on enhancements to operational tools, as well as opportunities to take ownership of various initiatives. Qualifications & Essential Skills: A successful candidate is expected to possess and demonstrate the following: Solid technical acumen including basic cloud technology, desktop technology and basic TCP/IP networking Ability to diagnose and fix technical issues with Windows operating systems Strong interpersonal and communication skills Self-motivated, driven and able to work in a team environment Ability to resolve conflicting high-priority requirements Strong leadership skills, including demonstrated ability to integrate multiple technical disciplines in achieving a stated objective Results-oriented professional committed to personally driving objectives to completion, maintaining flexibility where an adjusted work schedule and/or evening/weekend work are required 2+ years of experience in a technical support engineer, desktop support engineer, IT help desk, or similar role, financial services is a plus Desirable Skills: Experience troubleshooting Java-based applications running on Windows OS Scripting or basic development language skills to automate common tasks Strong technical writing skills or previous documentation experience and familiarity with Confluence Azure AZ-900 certification desired, but not required Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or technical related certification desired Japanese language skills is a plus, but not required Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Job_Title: Market Data Technical Support Engineer/Junior Market Data Support Engineer
Job_Descriptions: Corporate culture and guiding principles: TP ICAP operates at the heart of the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets. We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world’s financial markets, covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy & Commodities. Globally, we are a leading provider of market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It’s supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality. Our clients include banks, insurance companies, pension and hedge funds, asset managers, energy producers and refiners, as well as risk and compliance managers and charities. We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties. Job Duties: · Ensuring optimal accuracy and timeliness of Data on a real-time basis while implementing monitoring tools to detect data issues. · Collaborating closely with internal teams and businesses units to manage data to drive sales channel targeting and accommodate client needs. · Resolving Data quality issues, this includes root cause analysis while managing internal and external vendors to resolve Data issues. · Ensuring Data security, this includes facilitating Data protection and compliance of customer's Data while incorporating emerging technologies to enhance existing Data Warehouse. · Flexibility to stretch and take challenges · Communication & Interpersonal skills, a team player. · Attitude to learn and execute · Role requires individual to work on weekends or public holidays to support or deploy solutions. · Resilient under pressure, have a mind-set of continuous improvement and can-do desire to provide excellent service. · Proactive approach to spotting problems, areas for improvement, performance bottlenecks, etc. · Act with integrity and due skill, care and diligence in carrying out your duties Principal Responsibilities · The candidate will be responsible for supporting and troubleshooting components that connect to electronic trading venues such as exchanges and client feeds. This includes related components such as integration with pre-trade risk checking systems. Qualifications/Skills Required · 5+ years of professional experience in financial institutions and/or financial services.Comfortable to dive into exchange specs and protocol definitions such as FIX protocol. · Proficient with OS and network level tuning and editing scripts on Windows/Linux platforms. · Scripting experience (Python or Linux bash or tcl). · Understanding of Asian feeds across the board. Experience of market-data platforms i.e. Refinitiv, Bloomberg, direct feed providers , cloud technology such as AWS, GCP. Basic networking/connectivity skills (e.g. Multicast, routing, TCP/IP working knowledge). · Ability to conduct self-learning, pick up new tools and able to be independent with minimal guidance from the project leads/managers Person Specification Knowledge · Degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or equivalent · Good to have: Financial markets/ trading business knowledge with exposure to market data products eg. Refinitiv (TREP), Refinitiv Workspace, jpassoc subscriber and compositor, contex, cityvision excelerator, Geneos, BPIPE , MPF experience with large scale/ high frequency/low latency distributed applications · Understands ideas and has a viewpoint on the markets and economy · Ability to collaborate with stakeholders outside of the immediate department ‘to get the job done’ · A thorough knowledge of at least 1 of the following must be demonstrated: a) TREP b) FIX protocol as used for Market Data · Knowledge of market Data Terminals such as EIKON or Bloomberg a distinct advantage · Basic knowledge of Excel using Real-Time data should be shown Skills Client Focused · Personable and engaging · Communicates effectively and efficiently to internal and external stakeholders · Build relationships and networks with both internally and externally wherever possible · Demonstrates strong customer focus · Demonstrates ability to work effectively with others · Constructively handles disagreements to reach a resolution · Ability to work with diverse groups/ personalities Innovative · Open to innovative ideas/ experiences and ability to create new ideas, approaches or insights · Seeks opportunities for improvements · Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity Dynamic & Competitive · Demonstrates high levels of energy in seeking out and achieving new goals · Goes that “extra mile” · Is a self-starter · Shows evidence of being comfortable working in fast paced or pressured environments · Enjoys a challenge and is able to escalate · Does not give up easily Open & Communicative · Adapts communication style to suit audience · Projects personal credibility · Interacts confidently without being overbearing · Ability to work effectively in a high pressure environment · Keeps emotions under control in difficult situations · Handles criticism constructively Professional Integrity · Able to demonstrate honesty, integrity and professionalism · Promotes loyalty to TP ICAP and its principles · Works ethically and shows respect for both professional and company values

General Description: This role is responsible for assisting in all legal related tasks of the Company's Group. Scope & Responsibilities: - Report to General Counsel. - Handle all legal related tasks of the Company’s Group (including the company’s holding company(ies), subsidiaries, related companies, associated entities, etc.). - Draft and negotiate all forms of agreements, memorandum of agreements, purchase agreements, shipbuilding contracts, memorandum of understanding, deeds, undertakings, merger & acquisition agreements, EPCIC etc. concerning different and various transactions of the Group. - Identify, manage and mitigate legal risk issues across the Group. - Ensure that the Group complies with legislation, regulation and the requirements of professional bodies and other organizations, including interpreting the effect on the Group of any proposed changes to legislation. - Provide preventative legal guidance and risk training to the Group. - Make recommendations/draft formal legal responses to issues. - Keep abreast of commercial law changes and draft best practice notes on topical issues for use across the Group. - Keep abreast of maritime law changes and make the appropriate adjustments to relevant policies and standards accordingly, including guidelines on acceptable and unacceptable terms and conditions of an agreement or a contract the Group shall enter into with a third party. - Assist with the development of the team and Group-wide legal and risk strategy, as appropriate. - Provide various legal advice for the Group’s corporate secretarial portfolio and review policies. - Handle day-to-day Group-wide corporate legal affairs. - Manage and oversee litigation, arbitration and certain legal matters handled by external counsels and liaise with external counsels (been admitted to Singapore bar for at least 2 years’ experience). - Stay up-to-date n applicable legal issues, trends and developments. - Able to travel on short notice. - Carry out other duties and responsibilities assigned by the Company from time to time. Requirements: - At least 3-4 years of relevant PQE in a corporate legal department, law firm or as an in-house legal counsel. - Been admitted to Singapore bar for at least 2 years’ experience. - Degree in Law or equivalent or higher qualification. - Resourceful, disciplined, proactive team player with effective interpersonal skills - Meticulous, organised and committed to delivering high-quality work - Excellent communication skills - verbal and written - Good listening skills - Problem analysis and problem-solving - Attention to detail and accuracy - Initiative - Stress tolerance - Team co-operator - High degree of professional ethics, and integrity Interested candidates, please submit your resume and only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

About the Department Analytics Support team is part of a wider Risk and Decision Management (R&DM) Division that is responsible for Risk/ Basel models implementation and enabling roll-out and tools via Quarterly Change Request (QR)  & Data management for UOB's Group Retail Bank, which covers exposures to consumers (Personal Financial Services ('PFS'), retail Small and Medium Enterprises (Business Banking ('BB')), and Private Banking ('PB') customers. Specifically, the division acts as an analytics function of Group Retail segment, to drive decision making based on value analytics throughout the customer value chain. Job Responsibilities 'Analytics Support & Decision Management Solution' team has been set up to execute the initiatives to (1) equip R&DM team members with the right tools, e.g. analytics tool, data, infrastructure, and (2) support the enabling of analytics to the users within Group Retail segment. In this role, the project team member anchor to manage Quarterly Change Requests delivery and enable Data management & tools for R&DM analytics  BAU and projects.  On project basis, he/she will participate & guide the assigned Singapore data-mart/ SAS /risk models initiatives for PFS & PB. Key Responsibilities - Provide support to the Head of Analytics Support & DMS team on the development of the infrastructure framework within R&DM, for the areas related to the Quarterly Change Requests and Data / data-mart management - Deliver Quarterly Change Requests (QR) for R&DM > Responsible for managing the function R&DM change requests via Quarterly Change Request (QR) boat size and Group Retail Demand Management RCAB prioritization, for Singapore and regional subsidiaries. > Drive change requests requirements, business analysis on problem statement, use case and benefits for CR RCAB prioritization > Responsible for delivery and complete User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for Singapore's Quarterly CRs. > Manage stakeholders / buy-in process for R&DM Head and Group Retail Demand RCAB prioritization. - Enable R&DM on tools and data for analytics > Deliver the weekly / monthly regular refresh of R&DM internal SAS data-mart assigned for SG > Support Data Management Team Lead for data management /projects on business analysis of business problems, use cases on data mart, SAS data sets automation jobs and Qlik admin support for SG - Provide assignment basis support (as 'Group role') to the regional team for Quarterly CR and Data management - Provide regular updates to Head of R&DM Analytics Support & DMS, Head of R&DM and senior management on key developments and issues Job Requirements Qualifications - Undergraduate degree in a relevant program. - Experience and proficiency in tools such as SQL, Relational Database, SAS datasets and experience in Credit Decision Analytical Data Management will be preferred. - Strong Business Analyst experience and able to do process mapping of business requirements and data /tools enablers required. - 4 to 6 plus years' related experience in retail credit portfolio, data management. Consulting and risk vendor experiences will also be considered - Project management e.g. planning, progress tracking and reporting, risk / issues log management, will be an added advantage - Exposure to IT systems and implementation projects > An appreciation of the System Development Life Cycle and project management methodologies > Able to assess upstream and downstream impact from changes > Able to perform business analysis, business process mapping and user requirements gathering. > Able to create the User Acceptance Test (UAT) test plan and complete UAT - Strong analytical skills - Good interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Able to interact effectively with a diverse group of people, e.g. business users, technical people and vendor - Self-starter, able to function with minimal supervision and to perform in a non-structured environment - Be able to find a balance of business and technical work - Experience in Java or Business Rules Engine code development will be a plus - Knowledge / experience in implementing of Machine Learning (ML) /Artificial Intelligence (AI) driven solution for Credit Underwriting processing and Data Analytics will be a plus Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. Accountable for delivering Programmes on time, within budget, and within scope. This individual will lead and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental, cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a Project or Programme, from Initiation to Closure. Overall Technical Delivery: Responsible to track the quality, scope, timeline, effort (co-related to estimation, CR’s, complexity), resources (includes GTO, business, vendor, contractor, Professional Services resources as well as operations Develop and execute the overall project plan and analyse project proposals which impacts the schedule and budget variance which in turn contribute to meeting the overall objectives of the project. Technology Role: Work with GTO teams for the technical/Infra setup and systems connectivity (e.g. SFTP, RFTS, SSL Certificates) Work with Business unit, Information Security, Group compliance, ORM etc. on the Security Risk assessment, Outsourcing due diligence. Track the Service Level Agreement. Stakeholder Management: Work hand in hand with Business Project Managers to manage project stakeholders and relationships - e.g. escalation, expectation, conflict, scope changes, etc. Ensure teams work in a collaborative environment Scope Management: Manage all changes to the agreed scope of work Review and assess all changes and impact to timeline and ensure all changes are approved by PSC Program and Project Governance: Prepare investment approval deck and manage approval of project by ITC/TAGC. Organize and facilitate PWC meetings. Risk and Issue Management: Manage overall project risk, track risk aging, work through escalations, change governance and related issues. Implement the risk mitigation plans Process Adherence: Partner with relevant stakeholders in ensuring that the system development methodology is followed and the relevant artefacts are delivered on time with quality, in adherence to the development methodology/approach Project Reporting: Measure, monitor and report progress to stakeholders at various levels of organization across the enterprise with the right quality, consistency in content. Implement project communication plan and review status reports prepared by project personnel and modify schedules or plans as required Requirement: At least 8 years of prior experience in Finance related projects (preferably Asset Management or Private Banking) with 3-5 years of experience in managing Digital platforms which includes web and mobile application. Demonstrated 8-10 years’ progressive management experience, including large-scale Project & Programme Management. Deep understanding of front to back development technologies (e.g. Restful APIs, React Native, etc.) Proven capability of leading teams across sites and geographies. Experience in managing vendor project implementations Project Management Professional (PMP) / PRINCE II certification is a plus.

Hiring_Company: MOET HENNESSY ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
Job_Title: Marketing & Retail Director, Travel Retail APAC
Job_Descriptions: Moet Hennessy aims at making its organization agile and efficient to deliver on our promises to shaping change, cultural and operational transformation. Our vision is to lead the future of luxury wines and spirits from nature to communities. Our company success will be created by pioneering people with passion for crafting experiences and turning challenges into opportunities to innovate. Part of the Travel Retail (TR) APAC leadership team, the Marketing & Retail Director will lead the Portfolio strategy and Retail projects accompanied with online & offline activities for the region to establish Hennessy & Champagne leadership while developing the whisky, white spirits & wines categories. The ambition is to maximize MH TR existing Retail statement and support the opening of new standalone stores by identifying new Retail opportunities and crafting memorable consumer experiences for Travellers with a primary focus on Chinese consumer and Digital. Primary function Lead the regional marketing strategy for TR APAC across all markets and brands by setting the direction and priorities for the region. You will provide support to the sales team in 360 planning of initiatives & product launches, digital / KOL and consumer engagement activities Create and drive the Digital and Social Media strategy Oversee the implementation of the marketing calendar across APAC region and the tracking of marketing activities Lead retail store design & construction, project management and visual merchandising executions for the region Work closely with the Central Teams to provide APAC specific feedback and coordinate information flow Accountable & responsible to manage the A&P budget for TR APAC to ensure key programs are supported with maximization of ROI in mind. Key responsibilities Elaborate APAC Omnichannel Marketing Strategy building Brand awareness & gaining market share: identify business opportunities in each market, orchestrate product launches from forecast to store across APAC based on the consumer profile, monitor brand performances Be a role model to the extended team in being the category expert, fully understanding market trends, Traveler behaviors and competitive landscape. Develop 360 consumer centric integrated campaigns to leverage innovation and High Traffic Moments: develop & plan trade-marketing activities, craft engaging online & offline luxury experiences, drive innovation integrating digital in store, develop clienteling, develop & implement digital campaigns including paid digital media, influencer marketing & extension to pre-order retailer sites Lead the Digital acceleration: define 360 strategy to accelerate business development across the portfolio & markets, upgrade & animate the Brand mini-program to continue to acquire data, drive traffic to store Lead the Retail design & construction function for TR APAC: identify new retail opportunities with the sales team, evaluate the potential of each project , implement retail design guidelines from Maisons & collaborate with Paris Central Retail Design & construction teams for Key Retail location Amplify awareness with trade, PR & VIP event such as boutique opening, sales ambassador conferences, Gala diner with press Lead, manage & develop a Travel Retail team of 10-15 pax Profile Reporting to the TR APAC Managing Director, you will work cross-functionally throughout the organization to ensure a good alignment & collaboration across all departments, more specifically with Retail design & Marketing Paris teams, APAC Sales team, domestic teams. The position requires a Retail & Digital Marketing expertise that supports a high Brand Standard. In this role, significant experience in Luxury Retail is required. You have the ability to work in a complex organization, in different countries across Asia Pacific and with a significant number of projects & brands. Effective communication is essential for the coordination of the projects from Paris to Markets and with external partners. At least 15 years marketing, retail & digital > 5 years international experience preferred Experienced in Luxury Retail (project management) Deep understanding of the Chinese Traveller and the digital space Strategic thinker with analytical skills Excellent project management skills Proven leadership in complex cross-functional environments Strong leadership & organizational skills to influence & motivate teams who may not directly report to this position with team player mindset to foster relationships Effective team player across diverse disciplines and cultures/ time zones Excellent communication & presentation skills with cultural diversities Good commercial sense, able to achieve the fine balance of sales returns and brand building Strong sense of design and its interpretation/ adaptation within international markets Solution & results-driven, responsible, independent with high level of initiative Fluent in English, Mandarin is a plus Available to travel approx 30-50% of time depending on borders opening

Hiring_Company: MOET HENNESSY ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
Job_Descriptions: Moet Hennessy aims at making our commercial organization agile and efficient to deliver on our promises to shaping change, cultural and operational transformation. You will also collate information required for C&B surveys and for other internal reporting purposes. You will be expected to support the streamlining of HR processes; review and ensure continual improvement and compliance in the internal HR and Payroll system and processes. Job_Descriptions: Job Purpose Be part of the Group Market Conduct family which strives to safeguard the reputation of the company, through oversight on distribution representatives' market conduct activities and ensuring enforcement actions taken are fair and appropriate. This position is for a role that sits within the Sales Compliance section with primary functions that consist of market conduct governance, executing the compliance monitoring program, and conduct sales assurance audits that includes Balanced Scorecard program. The Job Working as a team to manage, enhance and execute the entire suite of Sales Compliance programs which includes Balanced Scorecard audit. Conduct client surveys and comfortable speaking to clients with negative experiences Manage expectations and communication with business units and agency force Understand regulations related to sales compliance and apply accordingly in your day to day work Support section/department-wide programs/working groups as required which will include sales assurance audits and any other projects as required Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices. Our Requirements Degree holder in any discipline with 1-3 years of relevant working experience Discipline in meeting strict timeline and goal oriented Good communication skills are critical to success in this position Possession of a broad knowledge of business, products and operations of the financial services industries, and familiarity with risk and compliance processes will be an added advantage Team player, with strong accountability over personal and team deliverables Experienced candidates in Audit, Project Management or Operations looking for a career switch will be considered as well Demonstrates alignment with the organisation's core values through expected behaviours. High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork. Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes. About Great Eastern Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner. We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us. We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people's lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management. Client Service Manager The Client Services Manager has primary responsibility for the management of a portfolio of the complex Corporate Trust clients/accounts and serves as the day-to-day contact for the assigned clients/accounts. As the primary account representative, the CSM is responsible for servicing the overall client relationship within the assigned portfolio. This shall include the day to day oversight of the assigned accounts, the coordination of services for assigned clients, the monitoring of contractual obligations for these accounts and administering debt issuance including various complex financing structures and services related to assigned corporate trust products. The CSM will also play a role with the Relationship Manager and Sales group in retentive marketing efforts for securing additional business opportunities with clients, law firms, investment bankers and other intermediaries and industry professionals. Additionally, the CSM will manage the relationships of assigned products, with the Portfolio Manager, Underwriter, Rating Agency, Accountants, Investors and Insurers) and active participation on products and services delivered. This role is responsible for addressing client issues proactively, efficiently and to the satisfaction of the client(s). The CSM will work in close communication and collaboration with the Business Managers, Client Administration, Client and Business Development, TMG as well as Business and Product Management to ensure the delivery of service excellence to our clients. Key Roles & Responsibilities: Transaction Administration and Control a) Thoroughly review new transaction documents related to the most complex Corporate Trust accounts, clients and/or relationships to ensure that transaction can be supported within current operating model. Understand the administration requirements b) be aware of and continually review provisions of governing documents, amendments and supplements and market impacting items, elevate to Guarded/Default status as necessary c) perform and/or oversee all account administration activities d) manage and oversee client inquiries, resolve situations independently and smoothly as they occur, escalate promptly where appropriate e) participate in compliance reviews as required f) minimize exceptions related to: audit, compliance, client complaints, overdrafts, failed trades, un-invested balances, report quality and timeliness etc. g) monitor and minimize outstanding fee receivables for portfolio of accounts. Collaboration/Stakeholder Engagement/Oversight/Influence a) Work with Global Service Delivery and other groups within Global Client Solutions and related parties to monitor/control tickler compliance of assigned accounts b) act as senior escalation point for the deal-related client/ counter party contacts Deal-level Relationship Management and Assisting in cross-selling a) Complete accountability for all service level aspects of the assigned client relationships for the deals that are administered b) Ensure that clients receive an excellent service through regular client service review calls and client scorecards c) Assist in the bid preparation process and analysis of retentive bids with existing clients where beneficial, assist in the identification and execution of cross-sell opportunities working in close consultation with CT Sales, CT Relationship Management and BNYM Client Executives d) Develop and maintain strong working relationships with other industry participants as applicable for assigned deal portfolio - e.g. law firms, financial advisors, investment bankers, etc. Qualifications Business Expertise The business knowledge for this role requires a high level of specific product(s) expertise and client awareness. A strong degree of knowledge is required in understanding process flows and business process to appropriately service the clients. The incumbent must also be able to work effectively with clients, industry experts and regulators to translate issues and develop appropriate solutions by working collaboratively with internal stakeholders to ensure seamless client service. Strong understanding of not only the Trustee aspects of transactions, but also business and procedural aspects, as well as risk management, compliance and audit concerns. Problem Solving Incumbent must be able to solve complex client problems facing off against very large and multi-dimensional clients. Incumbent must be able to develop, implement and use different ideas and management styles in a very fast moving environment with multi-time zone challenges. Interaction / Interpersonal Skills This position could require making presentations and having the interactions to the Senior stakeholders. This role requires solid negotiation skills, business acumen, ability to have a global perspective with very large global clients, be seen as a trusted partner internally and equally important externally, strong collaboration, excellent influencer skills, ability to manage multiple priorities, and strong analytical thinking.

Audit Manager About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities To provide an independent assessment of the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls and compliance of the Businesses and Functions in the country with laws, regulations and internal policies To ensure audit activities in the country are executed as required by local regulatory requirements and provide country management with assurance that local regulatory requirements as well as the expectations of the local regulator are fully met. To contribute towards country risk assessments to enable the Country Head of Audit (CHOA) to provide input to the Functional audit teams to determine their audit plans. To contribute towards an anticipatory approach to risk assessment to Group Internal Audit (GIA) by highlighting issues through good stakeholder communication in order to improve audit planning Act as liaison with Management to ensure full understanding of business strategy, plans, products, performance and risk-related issues at business unit via bottom-up continuing risk assessments and dialogues. To perform audit work as a team member / leader in accordance to Group Internal Audit's Charter, methodology, procedures and timelines. Key Roles & Responsibilities Effectiveness of and proactive contribution towards country risk assessments and audit planning. Timely execution of Country Audit Plans through managing, leading or participating in audit work. Consistently deliver high quality audit reports in a timely manner with audit issues focussed on key risks, root causes, materiality and succinct messages. Timely escalation of audit issues and past due audit issues. Exhibit effective leadership and engagement with Business, Function Heads and team members Effective engagement and good relationship with local regulators. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. As part of GIA to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Our Ideal Candidate 5 years relevant working experience as professional auditors or business practitioners with core audit / business skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills, with ability to gain the respect from peers, senior management and business stakeholders Confident and courageous to raise concerns and issues in a proactive and professional manner Self-directed and able to work with minimum supervision, escalating issues in and appropriate and timely manner Accounting / Audit qualification is strongly preferred (including e.g. IIA, ACA, ACCA, CPA, CISA) Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Product Marketing Director Your role Are you a seasoned solution marketer? Do you enjoy using your skills and experience to drive change and increase revenue? We're looking for a customer-centric Financial Services Solutions Marketing Director for our APAC region to help develop and lead the GTM strategy and execution for IHS Markit's Financial Services portfolio of solutions, which span five key areas; 'data & analytics', 'post trade processing', 'risk, compliance and reporting', 'financial technology solutions' and 'economic & country risk'. Key responsibilities: Working with key stakeholders across the Financial Services division and marketing & communications team, and using market research, customer feedback and sales priorities, you will develop compelling and content rich value propositions by target audience which will drive the GTM strategy for marketing communications into target segments Implement, plan, develop and measure integrated global marketing programs to align with the 'Buyers Journey', including awareness, PR, inbound and outbound demand generation, pipeline building, sales acceleration and localization Help grow and implement new digital inbound marketing strategies to help drive further demand from online activity Develop global sales enablement assets and implement training strategies to instruct sales on understanding target audiences, value propositions, buyer preferences, needs, and challenges Build and maintain key relationships with multiple internal stakeholders, including: Financial Services leadership, Sales, Product Management and other worldwide and/or regional/local teams to define and implement GTM strategies with emphasis on the customer Define target Return on Marketing Investment (ROMI) and track progress against those targets Build awareness and generate qualified, sales-ready leads; partner with Sales to drive conversion of leads to pipeline opportunities and closed deals. Evolve strategic alliance partner marketing relationships to increase visibility and drive end user demand for IHS Markit data/solutions via 3rd party platforms. Help shape an effective, results- and metrics-oriented marketing organization; work with internal resources, including sales and product management organizations to develop professional marketing communications Manage timelines, budgets, resources, and staff and maintain effective communications and relationships with internal and external partners. Extensive experience within the financial services industry or a financial technology related vendor or a consulting firm with financial services/technology related expertise. Prior management experience and proven leadership competencies with the ability to mobilize, motivate and inspire employees and retain talent is valuable. Digital inbound marketing skills covering a wide range of online channels You are Highly collaborative Able to achieve goals through influencing, partnering and developing productive relationships with senior leaders internally and with 3rd party partners and influencers externally. (Encompasses financial analysis, definition of business drivers, assessment of risks etc.) Advisory to the Steering Committee for projects / programmes of work with the aim of ensuring successful delivery and maintenance of strategic programme objectives Partnering with business and programme teams to clarify priorities, stakeholder management, design governance, and TOM implementation activities. Familiar with key functions of an investment manager, e.g. Front, Middle and Back Office, Distribution, Product Development, Technology and Corporate Functions Experience leading multiple large and complex consultancy assignments concurrently An understanding and experience of iterative delivery methodologies, such as Agile and Scaled Agile Significant understanding and experience of change management disciplines, processes and tools, such as: The key stages and lifecycle of change delivery Stakeholder Management  Planning and progress tracking mechanisms Monitoring and managing issues, risks and dependencies Governance and reporting What will be good to have IMC Professional or higher level degree qualifications (e.g. CIMA, CFA) Relevant Change Management qualifications (e.g. Agile/Scrum, Prince II) What you'll be like Proven track record managing Change teams including objectives setting, mentoring and appraisals Enjoys solving problems and adopting proactive approach through use of technology. Job_Title: AVP, IT Audit Manager/Senior IT Auditor (App), Digital & Technology Audit, Group Audit
Job_Descriptions: AVP, IT Audit Manager/Senior IT Auditor (App), Digital & Technology Audit, Group Audit OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Audit provides objective assurance that the Group functions effectively to accomplish its objectives within the established risk appetite. We adopt a risk-based systematic approach to evaluate and provide recommendations to improve the effectiveness of internal control, risk management and governance processes. Apart from business unit-specific audit departments, find opportunities within our Regulatory Capital Audit, Credit Risk Review, Investigation, Audit Methodology & Standards and Programme Management Office departments. Key Responsibilities: Audit Management Plan and manage audit engagements and ensure that relevant technology, information and cyber risks and control gaps and lapses have been identified, appropriately assessed, and reported. Conduct audits/reviews on Applications, IT Infrastructure, as well as Information, Cyber and Digitalisation risks. Support business audits by providing technology audit expertise and evaluate the IT controls supporting business operations. Assist the Head of Department/Senior Audit Manager in the delivery of their role and responsibilities. Stakeholder Management Work as business partners with stakeholders across the Group, and assist the HOD/Senior Audit Manager to better manage business and Technology, Information, Cyber, and Digital risks. Communicate audits/reviews observations and writing audit and ad-hoc reports for delivery to, and agreement with, auditees. Team Management Possesses qualities essential as a leader over a team of auditors for assigned audit engagements/reviews Complete working papers for audits/reviews through documenting the work conducted, describing the work performed and the evidence that supports the observations and conclusions, as well as reviewing the work performed by other team members. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: University Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Professional certifications such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) (For AVP) Minimum 6 years of working experience, with at least 4 years in IT audit (For MGR) Minimum 4 years of working experience, with at least 2 years in IT audit Willing and able to operate effectively in a leadership position or a team player Independent and committed with high level of initiative Good written, verbal communication and presentation skills Strong interpersonal and communications skills High level of integrity, drive, and sense of urgency Willing to travel 10%-20% (MY/CN primarily, with occasional worldwide) At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Audit (Internal Audit) - Technology Audit Manager - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Audit (Internal Audit) - Technology Audit Manager - Singapore Company Profile Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services company providing a wide range of investment banking/ securities/ investment management and wealth management services. The Firms employees serve clients worldwide including corporations/ governments and individuals from more than 1200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader/ the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together/ we share a common set of values rooted in integrity/ excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn/ to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles/ perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. Our core values: Committing to Diversity and Inclusion/ Putting Clients First/ Doing the Right Thing/ Leading with Exceptional Ideas and Giving Back underpin everything we do in Morgan Stanley. Department Profile Internal Audit Department (IAD) is responsible for validating whether the Firm operates in a controlled environment with appropriate risk management processes. Auditors evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of the Firms internal controls using a risk-based methodology developed from professional auditing standards. IAD assists in monitoring the Firms compliance with internal guidelines set for risk management and risk monitoring/ as well as external rules and regulations governing the industry. The team reports directly to the Board Audit Committee and helps verify whether the Firm meets all of its fiduciary responsibilities to shareholders/ while adhering to corporate-governance standards and legal and regulatory requirements. IAD comprises of a team of auditors with a diverse skill sets in business/ compliance and financial crimes/ risk management/ operations/ finance/ information security and technology/ working together to identify/ monitor/ assess and report on the control environment of the Firm. Asia IAD/ as the 3rd Line of Defence (LOD)/ is responsible for audits across all Morgan Stanley businesses/ support and control functions/ including the 1st and 2nd LOD/ in the region. The audits are designed to assess the adequacy of the control environment and to provide the Board Audit Committee and relevant regional committees with an independent assessment of risk across the Firm. IAD continues to strive to provides insightful viewpoints on leading indicators and topical matters that are most relevant to the Firm/ use the most effective and cutting-edge means to accurately evaluate the stability of risk controls/ and empower its team members to contribute and succeed in their career. Role Description Morgan Stanley IAD is currently seeking an experienced Technology Audit Manager for its Singapore-based audit team with a focus on the application and system infrastructure controls that impact the business risks. Based in Singapore and reporting locally to Head of Singapore Internal Audit and functionally to the Head of Technology Audit based in Hong Kong/ the successful candidate will be supporting the Singapore and Asia audit teams to perform risk assessments/ planning/ execution and reporting of regional and global audits/ and continuous monitoring activities.
